name: MultiQC_v1.2.0
title: MultiQC_v1.2.0
summary: Multiqc -  Generates a run-wide visualisation of QC reports

inputSpec.name: MultiQC_docker
inputSpec.label: Docker image tar.gz of the MultiQC tool

inputSpec.name: eggd_multiqc_config_file
inputSpec.label: MultiQC config file
inputSpec.help: must have an 'sp' key that specify all modules to be displayed in the report

inputSpec.name: single_folder
inputSpec.label: OPTIONAL select if you want to run MultiQC on a single data folder
inputSpec.help: only and all files in project:/path/to/folder/* will be downloaded and passed to MultiQC

inputSpec.name: project_for_multiqc
inputSpec.label: Project that holds QC outputs, eg '002_200306_K00178_0254_AHGGF7BBX'
inputSpec.help: Project that holds QC outputs, eg '002_200306_K00178_0254_AHGGF7BBX

inputSpec.name: ss_for_multiqc
inputSpec.label: Output directory name of the main workflow, eg 'dias_v1.0.0-200430-1' OR a specific folder within the project
inputSpec.help: Name of the directory that holds the QC data: single sample/main workflow OR absolute path to a single folder. Examples: 'dias_single_v#-TWE_v#-YYMMDD-1' or 'uranus_YYMMDD_1' or '/foo/bar/all_QC_files/'

inputSpec.name: ms_for_multiqc
inputSpec.label: OPTIONAL Multi-sample workflow output directory, eg ' dias_multi_v1.1.1-TWE_v1.0.6-YYMMDD-2'
inputSpec.help: Name of the directory that holds the multi sample workflow output data, in format ms_workflow_version-date-number, eg 'multi_v1.0.0-200430-1'

inputSpec.name: custom_coverage
inputSpec.label: OPTIONAL Do you want target bases coverage to be calculated at 200, 250, 300, 500 and 1000x?

outputSpec.name: multiqc_html_report
outputSpec.label: MultiQC output file
outputSpec.help: An html file archive containing the report as generated by MultiQC.

outputSpec.name: multiqc_data_files
outputSpec.label: MultiQC output files
outputSpec.help: Text files containing QC metrics parsed by multiqc.
